intro: Selleophytum buchii, commonly known as the Buch's selleophytum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish or greenish flowers that are typically borne on short, erect stalks. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
